code: estimate_sgd(   inputData,   calibratableParams,   constParams,   windowSize = 120L,   warmUp = 1500L )

title: Estimate the SGD volume. — estimate_sgd
text: inputData data frame containing input data model. calibratableParams list calibratable parameters. constParams list constant parameters. windowSize integer indicating period want average recharge. warmUp integer indicating number days warm model.

title: Estimate the SGD volume. — estimate_sgd
text: SGD_ESTIMATION_DF class.

title: Estimate the SGD volume. — estimate_sgd
text: Estimate SGD volume based Strack (1976) analytical solution. inputData data.frame containing required columns model (R, E0, Pumping, GWL, H2O_SB1, H2O_SB2). R numeric vector daily precipitation (mm). E0 numeric vector daily potential evapotranspiration (mm). Pumping numeric vector daily pumping rate (m3/d). GWL numeric vector initial groundwater level (mm), first value used initial value SB1. H2O_SB1 numeric vector initial water level first soil bucket (mm). first value used initial value SB1. H2O_SB2 numeric vector inital water level second soil bucket (mm). first value used initial value SB2. calibratableParams list calibratable parameters. recommended use json_to_paramter_list create list. windowSize integer indicating period want average recharge. warmUp integer indicating number days warm model.

text: Plot SGD estimation results

title: Plot the SGD estimation results — plot.SGD_ESTIMATION_DF
code: # S3 method for SGD_ESTIMATION_DF plot(   x,   y,   vars = c("wl", "SGD", "Wrechg"),   base_date,   type = c("pred", "comp", "input"),   obs_x = "date",   obs_y = "wl",   xbreaks = 10,   ybreaks = 5,   maxRange = 600,   coeff = 0.3,   names = c("wl", "SGD", "hn", "xn", "Wrechg", "WrechgAve"),   colors = c(obs = "red", precp = "blue", pumping = "green", est = "blue"),   color_labels = c(obs = "Observed GWL", precp = "Precipitation", pumping = "Pumping",     est = "Estimated GWL"),   labels = c("WL~(m~AHD)", "SGD~(m^3/d)", "h[n]~(m~AHD)", "x[n]~(m)", "w[recharge]~(mm)",     "w[recharge[ave]]~(mm)"),   ... )

title: Plot the SGD estimation results — plot.SGD_ESTIMATION_DF
text: x object class sgdEstimation. Created estimate_sgd. y data.frame daily observed groundwater level data. See Details. vars character vector variables plot. Can '' subset 'wl', 'SGD', 'hn', 'xn', 'Wrechg', 'WrechgAve'. base_date valid string can transformed data format using ymd. type character string indicating type plot. Can one 'pred', 'comp', 'input'. obs_x character string indicating column name date observed data. obs_y character string indicating column name groundwater level observed data. xbreaks integer indicating number breaks x-axis. ybreaks integer indicating number breaks y-axis. maxRange numeric indicating maximum range first axis (groundwater level). coeff numeric indicating shrink coefficient precipitation. names character vector variable names plot. colors named character vector colors use color_labels named character vector labels colors. labels character vector variable labels plot. ... Additional arguments passed plot function. (currently implemented)

title: SGDr (development version)
text: unknown pumping rate now available calibration. (Still general purpose function, just case study) window size now available calibration. warm period now available model, implemented C++. package now using S3 method SGD_ESTIMATION_DF class. plot, print summary methods available SGD_ESTIMATION_DF class. package totally re-constructed using OOP. Now 2 classes Model Parameters, respectively. achieved results efficiency applying changes. However extensibility much larger. Model class Parameters class still development.
